chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis L. Rice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No unauthorized contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by agent.
No unauthorized internet use unless approved by agent.

All conditions pursuant to page 18 of PSI.
Complete all programming.
Maintain compliance with Sex Offender registry.
Maintain GPS on work vehicle.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
3 days credit if revoked.

Court allows probation and/or jail time to be served in Lincoln or Marathon County. Court also gives agent discretion on how jail time is served at once or two different portions.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: Eligible for huber under jail criteria. To commence within 45 days or at discretion of agent. I&S 4 months for rule violations.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Case Called: 1:10pm. Clerk: Denise. State appears by Deputy DA Theresa Wetzsteon. Defendant appears by and with Atty Peter Rotter. PSI received by all parties. Atty Rotter recites corrections or ommissions. Arguments by State (18mins); by Defense (26mins). Defendant makes brief statement. COURT addresses Atty Rotter for some clarification. Atty Rotter makes statements.  COURT makes findings. COURT ORDERS: SWH - 10 yrs probation. CONDITIONS: 1 yr jail; 8 months if eligible with huber and under jail criteria for huber; to commence within 45 days or discretion of the agent; Crt does not authorize EMP; Impose & Stayed 4 months for rule violations; All conditions pursuant to page 18 of PSI - Complete all programming; payment of court obligations and supervision fees; fulltime employment and/or school; maintain compliance with Sex Offender Registry; No unauthorized contact with anyone under age 18 unless approved by agent; No unauthorized Internet use, unless approved by agent; maintain GPS on work vehicle; DNA Sample & Surcharge; Court Costs. 3 days credit if revoked. Crt informs & defendant signs Ineligible Voting Form. PSI retained confidential by State. PSI by Court and Defense returned to Court File. Atty Rotter requests 60 days to commence conditionally jail time. Statements by State. Crt makes clarifications. COURT gives probation agent discretion on how jail time is served at once or two different portions. COURT allows probation and or jail to be served in Lincoln or Marathon County. Adjourned: 2:34pm
Sentencing hearing on April 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

$5,000.00 signature bond with first $1,500.00 in cash.     No contact with any juveniles under 18 years of age unless supervised by an adult over 25 years of age.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No computers except at work.
